page.title: 01Combpyne Rousdon E Devon
page.content: An area of high ground, rising to over 500 feet, forming a watershed between rivers Axe and Lim.Entirely rural, with small family owned farms. On high ground, where gradients are gentle, mostly arable land (wheat,barley, rape, maize oats, kale) with large fields and low slashed hedges. Steeper valleys have permanent pasture for sheep and dairy/beef cattle, with small fields with woodland edges, and copses on steepest banks or masking former quarries. Settlements, Combpyne, with St Marys Church of 12th century origin, and Rousdon (combined adult population 214). Rousdon is dominated by the former Peek estate, now Allhallows independent co-educational school for 300 pupils aged 13-18. Social events centre around the Peek Hall (former village school)
